storage
Class StorageHelper

java.lang.Object
  storage.StorageHelper

public class StorageHelper
extends java.lang.Object

Helper class for generating and parsing messages sent to and received from the distributed content storage database

Version:
20130411
Author:
Michael Collis (mcollis@seas.upenn.edu)

Method Detail

makeGetMessage

public static java.lang.String makeGetMessage(java.lang.String docHash)
Constructs a GET request message for the content database

Parameters:
docHash - SHA-256 hash of document content to be retrieved
Returns:
Message formatted to be understood by the content database

makePutMessage

public static java.lang.String makePutMessage(java.lang.String docHash,
                                              int byteLength)
Constructs a PUT request message for the content database

Parameters:
docHash - SHA-256 hash of document content to be added to the database
byteLength - length in bytes of UrlContent to be transmitted
Returns:
Message formatted to be understood by the content database

makeContainsMessage

public static java.lang.String makeContainsMessage(java.lang.String docHash)
Constructs a CONTAINS query message for the content database

Parameters:
docHash - SHA-256 hash of document content to be checked
Returns:
Message formatted to be understood by the content database

parseDocHash

public static java.lang.String parseDocHash(java.lang.String message)
Parses the docHash from an incoming message

Parameters:
message - Message sent to the storage DHT
Returns:
SHA-256 hash of the document contents being referenced by the message

parseMessageType

public static int parseMessageType(java.lang.String message)
Parses the message type from an incoming message

Parameters:
message - Message sent to the storage DHT
Returns:
Message type indicated by one of the constants enumerated in this class

parseContentLength

public static int parseContentLength(java.lang.String message)
Parses the content length from an incoming PUT message

Parameters:
message - Message sent to the storage DHT
Returns:
Length of the content being sent in characters; else, returns -1 if the message is malformed or the length is invalid
